info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 4:31PM EDT until July 15 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Bay.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Hiland Park, Southport, Vicksburg, Recota Beach, Brannonville, Bayhead, College Station, Dirego Park, Camp Flowers, Bayou George, Magnolia Beach, St Andrews State Park, Biltmore Beach, Bennett, Gulf Lagoon Beach, Gainer Spring and West Panama City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING
